author: Dan C
title: Responsible Investing Dapp
description: Securing gains from crypto investments takes discipline, precision, and consistency. Something a lot of us lack in this space!

assessments.note:
This proposal describes a Limit order on a DEX. So it would be more effective to actually implement this on a dex. 

It can't be said for sure that this is acually a problem that needs to be solved. I think we can trust people to handle their funds.

The problem/challenge is clearly stated and one that is experienced by us all, undoubtedly. The solution presented is also simple and one that many would gladly rely on; to automate the process and kept distant from any emotional decisions. Such a solution could be deployed not just for ADA for but the entire crypto space.
This proposal lack details, and is very expensive for what it is providing.

Draft proposal. The problem and description are reasonable and the idea has potential, but there is no plan, so there is no way to assess the alignment of the proposal with the challenge and its potential for impact. Please, provide more detailes so we can give more feedback.

Like one of the comments mentions, there are already several platforms that offer similar services and this proposal dos not offer any details regarding what would differentiate this dApp from them and why it would benefit the Cardano ecosystem.
I would like to add the option not only transfer ADA into a stablecoin, but to any other pair a user can choose on the setting. And be able to do it on a limit sale or at a stop loss

Potentially an interesting idea but it doesn't go into needed detail to consider it seriously at the moment. Proposal needs more thought and information to be included to understand it better. It's is hard to judge merits of this proposal with the absence of supporting materials.

There is no information about the proposer/team. There is a mention of large connections to the business world but no examples given. There is no plan how the proposal is to be achieved. For 50k there has to be more informations.

The proposal does not elaborate on any background nor experience to provide confidence that this solution can be implemented. It would benefit from the presentation of credentials and/or by stating the team put together and their relevant experience to demonstrate that the DApp can be built within a timeframe and a budget.

No detailed plan or technical experience. What oracle are you using for price assessment? How is the exchange conducted? What stablecoin and where is it held? What about tax implications? It may be more tax effective to hedge with a derivatives product and not exit into a stable coin. Would you line up transactions with staking windows?
Draft proposal. There is no plan and there is no indication of relevant experience for creating a dapp.
The proposer describes himself an entrepreneur with a large network but offers no additional info and links to back it up. The detailed plan, budget etc should have been included.
It will require a good development team and a plan. I am missing a thorough plan right now

There is no information provided that would enable us understand on a deeper level what the experience or past relevant work looks like. Things such as Linked in profile, or other credible references would have been really useful.
The proposal is really short. There is almost nothing to assess. For the next time a more detailed proposal and a clear roadmap would be great.

Unfortunately, there's not enough information provided in this proposal to assess viability nor audibility that it's impossible to give it any measure of effectiveness in addressing the challenge. The $50000 price tag will require more details in order for this proposal to go any further.
No detailed plan provided to allow assessment of likelihood of success.
Draft proposal. There is no information that makes it possible to assess the auditability of this proposal. I recommend including details and following the Catalyst documentation.

Especially in the case of proposal like this one, there needs to be a very detailed description of the app functions, to help determine the need and utility of it. Suggest re-submission for a future fund, but with a detailed description, a detailed budget, a roadmap, KPIs and so on. It is all mentioned in the self-assessing checklist.
Too little documentation is provided to make a professional  audit possible

Unfortunately, this proposal does not offer enough information that would allow us to be able to determine the length of this assessment. There is no clear roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. Neither metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal. Including these in the future would make it for an easier proposal to understand.

solution: Dapp that automatically converts a percentage of holdings (ada) to a stable coin when your crypto increases by a specified percentage.
experience: Entrepreneur with a large network of connections in the business/finance world.
